Source code for golem.core.core

import sys, argparse, os, importlib

import utils



[docs]def execute_test_case(project, test_case, driver_selected):

    print 'Executing test case \'%s\'' % test_case

    #exec('import %s.test_cases.%s' % (args.project, test_case_selected)) #module = __import__(module_name) #class_ = getattr(module, class_name) #instance = class_()
    #get test data
    data_dict_list = utils.get_test_data(project, test_case)

    #run test case for each row in test data
    for data_dict in data_dict_list:

        #pre operations
        driver = None
        #get driver browser instance
        driver = utils.get_driver(driver_selected)

        modulex = importlib.import_module('projects.%s.test_cases.%s' % (project, test_case), package=None)
        test_class = getattr(modulex, 'Testclass')

        #instance = test_class(driver, data_dict)
        test_class(driver, data_dict)
        #post operation
        driver.quit()




[docs]def execute_test_suite(project, test_suite, driver):
    suite_module = importlib.import_module('projects.%s.test_suites.%s' % (project, test_suite), package=None)
    print 'Executing suite \'%s\' (%i test cases)' % (test_suite, len(suite_module.test_case_list))

    for test_case in suite_module.test_case_list:
        execute_test_case(project,test_case,driver)




[docs]def execute_from_command_line():

    sys.dont_write_bytecode = True #remove for performance

    parser = argparse.ArgumentParser(description='description',
        usage='golem project_name test_case|test_suite [-d driver] [-r repeat]')
    parser.add_argument('project', metavar='project', nargs='?', help="project name", default='')
    parser.add_argument('test', metavar='test', nargs='?', help="test case or test suite to execute", default='')
    parser.add_argument('-d', metavar='driver', default='firefox', choices=['firefox', 'chrome', 'ie'], help="driver name, options: ['firefox', 'chrome', 'ie']")
    parser.add_argument('-r', metavar='repeat', default=0, help='times to repeat test', type=int)

    args = parser.parse_args()


    #current working directory
    #os.path.dirname(os.path.abspath(__file__))
    #cwd = os.getcwd()

    #check if project parameteris not present
    if args.project == '':
        print 'Usage:',parser.usage
        print '\nProject List:'
        sys.exit()
    #check if project does not exists

    if not os.path.isdir('projects\\%s' % args.project):
        sys.exit("ERROR: the project %s does not exist" % args.project)

    #check if test parameter is not present
    if args.test == '':
        print 'Usage:',parser.usage
        print '\nTest Case List:'
        print '\nTest Suite List:'
        sys.exit()

    #check if test case or test suite exists
    if os.path.exists('projects\\%s\\test_cases\\%s.py' % (args.project, args.test)):
        execute_test_case(args.project, args.test, args.d)
    elif os.path.exists('projects\\%s\\test_suites\\%s.py' % (args.project, args.test)):
        #test_suite = '%s\\test_suites\\%s.py' % (args.project, args.test)
        execute_test_suite(args.project, args.test, args.d)
    else:
        sys.exit("ERROR: no test case or suite named %s exists" % args.test)



if __name__ == "__main__":

    main()
